title: Drunk
data:
- *This article is about the Drunk role that appears in some variants of NetHack. For the effects of quaffing a non-blessed [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze"), see [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion").*

The **Drunk** is a [role](/wiki/Role "Role") in the variant [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

The Drunk first appeared in an early version of [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") ([NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10")) but was dropped from the code at the time the [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") branch was ported into that variant.

The Drunk enjoys several unique benefits from drinking [potions of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze"), in addition to the 10-30 points of [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition") that normally come from the potion. Drunks get an extra 100 points of nutrition from drinking booze, regardless of its [BUC](/wiki/BUC "BUC") status, and are also healed by up to [rnz](/wiki/Rnz "Rnz")(20 + [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level")) [points](/wiki/Hit_points "Hit points"). Drinking booze will still cause [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion") and abuse [wisdom](/wiki/Wisdom "Wisdom"), however.

They are always neutral, and can be a human, dwarf, gnome, hobbit, nymph, or kobold.

## Skills

NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), which predated the [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") system, so Drunks could use any weapons.

| Drunk skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max          | Skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Basic        | - *Weapons:* [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail"), [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn"), [firearms](/wiki/Firearms "Firearms")
- *Combat:* [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding")
- *Spells:* [divination](/wiki/Divination_spell "Divination spell"), [body](/wiki/Body_spells "Body spells"), [musicalize spell](/wiki/Musicalize_spell "Musicalize spell") |
| Skilled      | * *Weapons:* [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart"), [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling")                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| Expert       | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [whip](/wiki/Whip "Whip")
- *Combat:* [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")                                                                                                                                                                                               |

The Drunk's [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell") is [detect food](/wiki/Detect_food "Detect food"), which unfortunately does not reveal the location of [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"). Spell success is determined by [intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence").

- SlashTHEM u\_init.c line 1500 in v. 0.8

## Techniques

- XL 1: Booze

The **Booze** technique allows the Drunk to simulate the effects of drinking [booze](/wiki/Booze "Booze") without needing the potion, including the role-specific benefits. ("You procure some refreshing drinks.")

## Intrinsics

- XL 1: [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")

## Starting equipment

- a +0 [rubber hose](/wiki/Rubber_hose "Rubber hose")
- 5 potions of [booze](/wiki/Booze "Booze")
- 3 stacks of 5 random potions each

The random assortment of starting potions, while not guaranteed to be desirable, may give the Drunk [starting knowledge](/wiki/Discoveries "Discoveries") of several harmful or beneficial potions, so the player can know from the beginning of the game which ones to collect or leave. The potions may also be useful for [alchemy](/wiki/Alchemy "Alchemy").

## Rank titles

- XL 1-2: Wino
- XL 3-5: Boozer
- XL 6-9: Drinker
- XL 10-13: Alcoholic
- XL 14-17: Slosh
- XL 18-21: Partier
- XL 22-25: Tastetester
- XL 26-29: Winetaster
- XL 30: Socialite

The [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") sees you fighting Colin Moriarty for the [Gourd of Infinity](/index.php?title=Gourd_of_Infinity\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gourd of Infinity (page does not exist)"), a neutral [horn of plenty](/wiki/Horn_of_plenty "Horn of plenty") which grants [ESP](/wiki/ESP "ESP"), [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage"), [hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination") resistance, and [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") while carried, and can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") to [charge](/wiki/Charge "Charge") objects (compare the [Platinum Yendorian Express Card](/wiki/Platinum_Yendorian_Express_Card "Platinum Yendorian Express Card")). Both the quest nemesis and quest leader, Andy Stahl, are based on [characters of](https://fallout.wiki/wiki/Colin_Moriarty) [the same name](https://fallout.wiki/wiki/Andy_Stahl) from *[Fallout 3](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fallout_3 "wikipedia:Fallout 3")*. The maps are taken from the [Wizard quest](/wiki/Wizard_quest "Wizard quest"); random monster generation is biased towards [gnome warriors](/wiki/Gnome_warrior "Gnome warrior"), [dwarf kings](/wiki/Dwarf_king "Dwarf king"), random [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_class\) "Gnome (monster class)"), and random [humans and elves](/wiki/Human_or_elf "Human or elf").

## Gods

The SlashTHEM Drunk's pantheon combines wine- and festival-related gods from Greek mythology:

- Lawful: Fufluns
- Neutral: Dionysus
- Chaotic: Pan

The lawful deity [Fufluns](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fufluns), the Etruscan counterpart of Dionysus, rather than Apollo appears as the neutral deity for [Bards](/wiki/Bard "Bard") instead.

## History

The Drunk's first appearance was in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") precursor [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10"), as one of nine new roles in addition to the twelve in [the contemporary version of NetHack](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"). The discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet. See [here](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/rec.games.hack/jg8YtQX1M3Y/tbBlteXdYY8J) for the relevant post.

After the release of [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3") in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to [NetHack-- 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack--_3.1.3 "NetHack-- 3.1.3") by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version. Due to some changes in the vanilla code, however, some content was removed to improve compatibility with NetHack. Most significantly, NetHack 3.1 had seen the addition of the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") branch. To avoid the challenge of fitting full-length quests for the roles that had been added in NetHack-- 3.0.10 into the patch code, those roles were simply left out of the patch.

The Drunk role, along with the other eight new roles in NetHack-- 3.0.10, made its reappearance in the variant SlashTHEM.

This article is about the Drunk role that appears in some variants of NetHack. For the effects of quaffing a non-blessed potion of booze, see confusion.

The Drunk is a role in the variant SlashTHEM.

The Drunk first appeared in an early version of SLASH'EM (NetHack-- 3.0.10) but was dropped from the code at the time the quest branch was ported into that variant.

The Drunk enjoys several unique benefits from drinking potions of booze, in addition to the 10-30 points of nutrition that normally come from the potion. Drunks get an extra 100 points of nutrition from drinking booze, regardless of its BUC status, and are also healed by up to rnz(20 + experience level) points. Drinking booze will still cause confusion and abuse wisdom, however.

They are always neutral, and can be a human, dwarf, gnome, hobbit, nymph, or kobold.

  • Lawful: Fufluns
  • Neutral: Dionysus

History

The Drunk's first appearance was in SLASH'EM precursor NetHack-- 3.0.10, as one of nine new roles in addition to the twelve in the contemporary version of NetHack. See here for the relevant post.

After the release of NetHack 3.1.3 in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to NetHack-- 3.1.3 by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version. Due to some changes in the vanilla code, however, some content was removed to improve compatibility with NetHack. Most significantly, NetHack 3.1 had seen the addition of the Quest branch. To avoid the challenge of fitting full-length quests for the roles that had been added in NetHack-- 3.0.10 into the patch code, those roles were simply left out of the patch.
